change.item: Encoded in EAD by Conversion and encoding by ArchProteus

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collections contains legal and administrative materials from the early 19th century from Orange County, New York.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: John G. Hurtin was Orange County sheriff in the early 19th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consits of two docket books for cases handled by John Hurtin as an Orange County sheriff, including lists of jurors and witnesses in cases heard before the Orange County Court of Common Pleas in Goshen, New York, 1811-1821; a register of insolvency cases, 1811-1812; and an account book, 1806-1816.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, John G. Hurtin Papers, 1806-1821. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Hurtin Papers).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from dealer John E. Scopes in 1966.
